channel.title: Airsoft
channel.description: [url=http://uk.youtube.com/watch?v=NhUm_HLM3Is]http://uk.youtube.com/watch?v=NhUm_HLM3Is[/url] Above is a quick video about it for those of you who dont know. Basically i want to start doing this very much, paintball is great and all but A) its expensive and B) its not very tactical. I am very annoyed that you need to be 18 to buy a gun but as to the age limit of playing i think i can still do that. Anyway i was wondering if any of you have had any experience with it? Do you like it? If not has this video made you want to go and do it aswell it sure as hell did for me

item.title: Airsoft
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

PkwizGM:

I live in New Zealand i have 2 bb guns what we do is put obstacles in the middle of the road nd park your parents cars jump in them wind down the window and snipe ppl in the head or body its way fun but we dinted some 150k car and we got growled at

Yeah I doubt you do that or you would get charged, or killed.

Read full topic

All anyone does is paintball, which is really fun but way too exspensive.

item.title: Airsoft
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:28, topic:234811”][quote author=Frell link=topic=309648.msg2475942#msg2475942 date=1223249550]

There are also spring pistols available, but personally, I don’t recommend getting one of those. Electric pistols are also available and I think they’re good too.

There are also sprung rifles, and they get a pretty bad rap, but I’ve had one kicking about for a few years (don’t play competitively, me and a few mates used to ping em about a bit but these days its been mainly relegated to scaring pidgeons when I can’t use the .22 :P) and its pretty good.

My AK is spring and is very accurate with .22. Anything under and they fly out of the way.
[/quote]Lies? Airsoft guns dont hold a .22 round?[/quote]
22g

Read full topic

item.title: Airsoft
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:13, topic:234811”]Buy an air rifle and go hunting pigeon, rabbit etc… Much more fun…

I’d do this if I was near a club, but I can’t give up real shooting because putting a pellet through a rabbits head and then skinning/cooking it is so much more satisfying.

Anyone whose done military training should find a sport like that easy though, I doubt anyone need play more than once a week. I don’t even consider airsoft or paintball to be real sports (mainly because in the UK they really aren’t)[/quote]
i do clay pidgeon shooting , over and under synergy shotgun for me anyway i would prefer this because i get to hit people

Read full topic

item.title: Airsoft
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

I have a M4 custom currently, clear though by Canadian law.
Fun as hell, specially when you make it so your opponent(s) screw with your hop and vice versa so then they curve everywhere. Fun but not serious. Serious matches are even better, makes you feel so extreme.

Read full topic
